1.name: Trouble in Turtle Town
1.obtainText: Hello traveller, my name is Fjorn. If you're looking to help out around here, we could really do with some help killing the snapping turtles invading the forest to the west.
1.completedText: Thank you for defeating those turtles!

2.name: Fred's Quest
2.obtainText: A neighbor of mine, Fred, has recently gone missing. I want you to go find him. Last time I saw him he was headed west into the forest.
2.incompleteText: I don't think its possible to see this text.
2.completedText: Fjorn sent you? Thank goodness you've arrived! I was hunting turtles for soup, when all of a sudden I was knocked out and thrown in a cage!

3.name: Fred's Soup
3.obtainText: I'm starving! I was out here collecting turtle meat so I could make my famous turtle soup. However, I'm feeling a little woozy...could you please collect five River Turtle Meat and bring it back to me?
3.completedText: Thanks so much! I need to get back to the village so I can make my soup!

4.name: Return to Freydell Village
4.obtainText: I appreciate all you've done for me, but I can take it from here. Return to Fjord and see what else he has for you.
4.completedText: Fred sent you back here? Well, good I have some future work for you.

5.name: Giant Turtle
5.obtainText: There's a giant turtle just west of Freydell Village, We believe it's the leader of the turtles invading the forest. Slay it and I will reward you fairly.
5.incompleteText: Have you slain the giant turtle

6.name: The Glacial Tundra
6.obtainText: Travel to The Glacial Tundra, it's just west of here. You can find my friend Higram there, he might have some work for you.
6.incompleteText: Have you traveled to The Glacial Tundra yet?
6.completedText: Ah, old man Fjorn sent you? Good. I have a lot of work that needs to get done.

7.name: A Cold Winter
7.obtainText: This winter is a brutal one... the trolls to the west raided our house and stole our furs, could you go hunt some mammoth so that we could use their fur?
7.completedText: Thank the lords! We will survive another winter.

8.name: Trolls to the West
8.obtainText: Those Trolls have been bothering us for too long! It's time we strike back! Go to their village, it's just west of here and slay them all!

9.name: Your Move, Chief
9.obtainText: The leader of the Trolls in the village is a powerful man. Take him down and they will lose their morale!
9.incompleteText: Have you killed the Troll Chieftan yet?
9.completedText: Finally... we can live in peace.

10.name: The Last of Them (Dungeon)
10.obtainText: I have reason to believe that there are more Trolls in a cave just north of the village. Find them and slay them. I will reward you handsomely.
10.incompleteText: Go find the cave and slay those Trolls!
10.completedText: Well done! Here is your reward.

11.name: Stamping out the Fires
11.obtainText: The Cultists are rallying outside of our camp to the north west. They need to be slowed down. Find and destroy five Cultist Bonfires and return back to me.
11.incompleteText: Have you extinguished the Cultist Bonfires?
11.completedText: Nice work! I have another task for you. Talk to me again when you are ready.

12.name: Full Momentum
12.obtainText: The Cultist Commanders are readying for their final assault. Take them out and let them know who they are messing with! You can find them in the encampments to the north west.
12.incompleteText: Have you slain those Commanders yet?

13.name: Overrun with Wolves
13.obtainText: These once peaceful lands have been overrun with wolves. My tribes can no longer survive here. Could you help us out?
13.completedText: I am very impressed with your skills. Talk to me if you need more work.

14.name: Alpha Wolf
14.obtainText: There is a nook just north east of here where the Alpha Wolf resides, I need you to slay it. If you follow the road west you should be able to find him.
14.incompleteText: Have you slain the Alpha Wolf?

15.name: Ironwell Camp
15.obtainText: Thank you for all of your help here. Without the trolls pestering us, we should be able to survive the winter. I think your help might be best used elsewhere. Last I heard, they have their hands full down in Ironwell City. Maybe if you go to the military camp just outside of the city they'll need some help. It's a bit of a trek south east of here.
15.completedText: You'd like to help? Well, I suppose we need all the help we can get. Let me see if I can find something for you to do.

16.obtainText: Hello there.. I see you have found yourself fighting in this world. We need capable adventurers like yourself. Up north you will find the Darrowswamps. This place is full of creatures the people of Valburn can not fight as we are mostly farmers and gatherers. Can you help and see what is going on in the swamps?
16.incompleteText: Have you dared to adventure up north, to the Darrowswamps yet?
16.completedText: Hello, Adventurer. You have been sent from the south? Any message? -no? -so strange... You want to help us here in these mystical swamps? That is great to hear! I believe you will have much work up here fore sure.
16.name: Something is Lurking in the North

17.name: Well Then... Here We Are
17.obtainText: For now, I just need a ale and this snakebite doesn't really help me move to the closest market. The closest market is to the east. The Sunspring Market. Can you go there and get me some antidote and ale?
17.incompleteText: Have you brung me the ale? The antidote? No?Man, my life hangs in the balance!
17.completedText: Thank you. You saved a weak adventurer's life. Now, where were we.

18.name: Chopping Their Supplies
18.obtainText: The Cultists in the woods just north of here have been chopping down trees to collect wood for the winter to come. If we can take that wood then we will be able to drive them out of the woods. Go collect all of the wood that they have chopped.
18.completedText: Nice! They won't last the winter without their wood.

19.name: Copper Ore...
19.obtainText: Hello, so you wish to craft your own armor? I bet you wish! Well, first you would have to find some Copper ore out in the world. Good luck finding any. Then, when you are ready you can smelt them at that forge over there.
19.completedText: You smelted some ore. The Copper bars are now visible in your bags.

20.name: It's Craftingtime!
20.obtainText: Now it is time to craft some armor on the anvil to the right of the forge..
20.incompleteText: Weak Flux or Copper Ores missing.
20.completedText: You crafted your first item! Check your bags to equip it.

21.name: More Ore?
21.obtainText:
I couldn't unnotice that you were over that anvil over there and forged yourself a armor piece? Is that right? That anvil is mine though, you would have to search for a Blacksmithing Approval to use my blacksmith area.

Head out there and gather some more ores and you may get my permission.
21.completedText:
See there. I take these. You were sent by me, remember.

Come back when I need you.

Thanks, now begone.

22.name: Adventure awaits in the swamp! ...when you are ready.
22.obtainText: Well, here lies the swamp. And I really want to fight alongside you in there, but I need to have a lookout from this post.
22.incompleteText: Shouldn't you be out there gaining glory for your cause? You seem a little lost, we can go into the swamps when you are capable of doing so.

23.name: Been waiting to lurk the swamps for too long...
23.obtainText: Yeah, well. my leader... ehm, to my left. He only accepts those he think is worthful to have with him into the swamps. And I am sure I have seen you before. Well, atleast, he is ready to have you with him in there! See it as a good opportunity and gain glory for the King and the Country!
23.incompleteText: So, you are not sure you want to join yet?
23.completedText: SO glad you would join us, -erhm, him! He should want to talk to you now. If you don't mind.

24.name: Mugglet.. My Dog!
24.obtainText:
Well, some weeks ago, I sent my nephew to guard and scout the swamps northwest of here. I also sent with him my dog! I miss my dear dog, Mugglet. I Wish that someone like you could by any chance check out on him? And my nephew at the same go.

Sadly I am stuck here for duty until next month and cannot go myself.

I hope you take my task.
24.incompleteText: Have you checked in on my Dog, Mugglet? I wish I could see him. I love him dearly.
24.completedText: The dog looks at you with a scared face. Like it has seen nightmares in the shadows of the swamp.

25.name: Mugglet's Current Lord
25.obtainText: Mugglet hints to you that his current Lord is near. He also hints you towards him.
25.completedText:
Oh, you found Mugglet! He is not mine, but I took him with me from Ironwell City! -Oh, you have met my nephew already? I am glad you show you cared for my family members! You can have this for your time.

Oh, you also wonder why the dog stands in the swamp entrance?

Isn't that what dogs are for? -To stay guard? Atleast for the night! That is what I use him for!

26.name: Is this Your Home?
26.obtainText: So you are awake? I was wonder who had camped in this illegal area. You should meet with the Mayor in the town north of here and hear what he has to say about illegal crimes.
26.incompleteText: Why haven't you packed down your tent yet? This area belongs to the King and his realm.
26.completedText:
You say you had camped by the waterfall, south of here? Why would I care, it's in the wilderness!

Well now, you look like a person that could take a fight! We could need people like yourself. Why won't you look around and see if you somehow can help us around here? -Dismissed!

27.name: Preservation
27.obtainText: We have to preserve the nature. Lately a flock of Hawks have came here to feed, leaving bloodsheds behind. I need someone strong and not as animal-caring as me, to do a important task. I need you to exterminate the Hawks and bring me three Poor Elegant Feathers. Go through Freydell Village, then over the bridge. There you will find their hideout - the Vespen Heights. Take care!
27.incompleteText: Have you done the nature's call? Are the hawks slain?
27.completedText: Ohh! I never thought I'd find someone like you. Maybe one day we can have a flirt or something? Rolling on the grass? What you mean by no? Oh.. well, that's alright then.

28.name: Weird Stuff is Happening
28.obtainText:
Hello, stranger. Something is wrong. Down southwest of here, over the bridge to the west, there is a very weird place. I have been there once. There are creatures there, terrible beings, I saw them, monstreous beasts! Legend says that these have broken free from dreams?! -Or as I like to say it; Nightmares!

Go and see for yourself if you don't believe me! Kill some while at it and bring me a proof you have been there! I get creeped out by all of this.
28.incompleteText: You aren't afraid of dreams, are you?
28.completedText:
So, it is true then? Huh, you saw glowing owls? That is not what my eyes met. I saw huge giant beasts with horns! I am sure you saw atleast glimpses of these terrifying beings. 

Or is everything just a dream?

29.name: Finally Awake
29.obtainText:
Hello, finally awake from your slumber?
Do you remember me? We met before you went to sleep four months ago.
How come you are able to sleep for that long?

Last time someone slept for that long, they had been protected by the unknown and the reason they were protected was to sacrifice themself in a later state. The unknown Gods walk among us and are not our friends.

But.. Have they granted you their protection?
29.completedText: If they have granted you their protection, I wonder why. For your sake I hope it is not because they have seen the future and knew that you would sacrifice yourself for someone important.

30.name: Finally Awake (Part 2)
30.obtainText:
While you have slept, our lands are at peril. The undead have marched into our very Kingdom, Alliances of Wild Clans have gathered togheter to make our Kingdom crumble. They want to hit us while we are down. Our troops are doing their best blocking the undead swarming from the east. We have farmers figthing trolls, we have fishers figthing mammoths, it's a mess. 

Also... A dark, unknown aura has been sensed by villagers and I believe of what they speak.
30.completedText:
I have seen you fight before, and I know you can do better than farmers. I believe you have been sleeping for a reason, I don't know why, but I have faith in you. 

Here is a bit of money that i don't need myself - take care!

31.name: He Who Stands Between Life and Death
31.obtainText:
You have clearly lost your memory, don't worry though, it will come back in time.
Now... Please meet with Arawel in the Verdant Grove, he may know what is happening.
31.incompleteText: Met with Arawel yet? He is in a grove just north of Freydell Village.
31.completedText:
Yes, hello? May I help you? 
Ah, so you say Veralynne sent you?

As a person that can see glimpses into the future and through life and death, this can mean only two things; either you are the person that will meet with the Deathlord from within their circles, or you are the Deathlord's pawn - which means... No, I cannot say. It is prohibited in my circumstances. I am just a faceless creature walking these lands...

32.name: Insight from the Past and the Future
32.obtainText:
Let me be serious for a second.
If you want to know some glimpses from your past and future, I need you to gather some ingredients for me. But know this, these ingredients are not something to meddle with.

Bring me three Cinderburry Herbs from southwest of Freydell. Bring me one Poor Elegant Feather and one Turtle Shell. -Yes, I need a bowl.
32.incompleteText: Found anything yet? Any feather or herbs?
32.completedText:
Yes, there we go! In perfect shape also!
I sense a great gatherer in you.

33.name: Insight from the Past
33.obtainText:
I just need to crunch these feathers a bit more before you can use the spellpowder.

Here it is!
The spellpowder that will reveal your past.

Go over to the fountain over there (In the "Verdant Grove") and start the ritual by using the spellpowder.
33.incompleteText: So, you not eager to hear about your past? Your loss of memory is strong. You should use this opportunity.
33.completedText:
You fade into a past dream and you rediscover some pictures from the past:

"A hole so deep it takes you to the inner core"

"Trolls working"

"A smile of a friend, a memory of joy. The person is standing by a cliff..."

"A family in deep danger, is it yours or someone else's?"
 
and at last you see:

"A forgotten cave, -by a waterfall. Silent, but unresting sounds whispers from the dark, are you....?"

The dream fades.

34.name: Insight into the Future
34.obtainText: as the dream fades you get a glimpse of a fountain south of Freydell Village.
34.incompleteText: The waters shows a Twin Fountain to the south of Freydell Village, you have had a vision of it before.
34.completedText:
Another dream appears, this dream seem to belong from the future:

"You see dead marching into the Kingdom, forming hardened creatures to spread their plague into the City of Ironwell."

"You see dead swamps and Hidden Secret chambers in a deserted land".

"You see only darkness around you, trying to suffocate you until your last breath, but the last breath may not be your last".

"You see a life in chains, but that isn't your hand, is it?".

"You see a crown and a crowd, you see blood, you see hope and anger".

"You see your past home, but it is...".

The dreams fades and you are only left with echoes in your head and pictures that make you question your destination even more."

35.name: He who.. Still Stands..
35.obtainText: You should probably meet with Arawel again.
35.completedText:
So... These were your visions. I can't say you have any great visions, they only showed you small details and you didn't get to learn so much. Anyway, I hope I have helped and I hope you take wisdom from what you have seen and use it for the good of our Kingdom.  

Oh, and take these coins, a creature like me won't have need for such.

I will head back to Evaste...
-Ehrm, ..bye. I am sure we will meet again. Maybe soon.

36.obtainText: I have reason to believe that the cultists have converted some of my farmhands. Go into the woods and find a Cultist Insignia so that we can figure out who the traitor is.
36.incompleteText: Have you found a Cultist Insignia?
36.completedText: Great, we can use this to find the traitors!
36.name: Thrill of the Hunt

37.name: Where is he?
37.obtainText:
We have been looking for our Scout for some time, I guess he has drowned in the Swamps like the rest of his men?
Anyway, I need you to check on him.
37.incompleteText: Have you found our Scout up north yet? He like to call himself a Adventurer.
37.completedText: So, the mistress sent you here? What a awful place to send someone. I am glad you are here though.

38.name: 99-Year Old Wine
38.obtainText: Inside the Barrel you find two coins and a 99-year old wine marked with two letters: R.J.

39.name: Unknown Figure
39.obtainText: An unknown weird figure made of clay is inside the barrel.
39.completedText: You pick the Figure. Feeling a sickening feeling in your body.

40.name: The Unknown Figure
40.obtainText: You should deliver the Figure to the Ironwell Priest. He should be able to tell you what curse the figure is bearing. Also, do not try to let go of the statue before he has investigated it.
40.incompleteText: Are you going to Ironwell anytime soon? You need to deliver that statue to the Ironwell Priest. Get going!
40.completedText: Oh, hello stranger. I sense a evil aura around you. Aha, so you are bearing on such darkness... A Darkcovered Figure.

41.name: Unlinked from a Dream
41.obtainText: I am sure there are monsters down there and we need to put a stop to this madness. Head down to the Owl Forest alone or with some friends and kill the Unlinked Creature.
41.incompleteText: Have you stopped this nightmare yet?
41.completedText:
Oh, Holy Moly!
You did it, I can again head back to that forest! Here is your reward for saving my mind before it went whole crazy!

42.name: A Letter for a Father
42.obtainText: Something catches your eye... A letter lies in the trash on the floor. It has a known symbol on it, which you can not remember, but you sure feel it is something you held dear.. before you lost your memory.
42.incompleteText: There is only trash lying here.

43.name: A Letter for a Father (Part 3)
43.obtainText:
Anyway, he has been silent for long now and he should have been here two days ago for his monthly visit.

Hey, maybe you can deliver him the letter for me? I would be grateful!
43.incompleteText: Still any chance you can deliver the letter for me? My father is in the Icy Tundras to the west of here.
43.completedText:
..You find Ral's father, but only in pieces.
What has happened here?

44.name: A Father's Medallion
44.obtainText:
In his hands you see a medallion with the same symbol on it. Maybe Ral wants it as a memory..

You may have to break it out of his frozen hands with force.
44.incompleteText: May he rest in eternal serenity.
44.completedText:
What?

No... this can't be true!

Noooooooo! Father! You were the only one I had left!

Father.... Noo... *sobs*

...Thank you for returning his medallion to me...

If I could be a bit alone now. I need time...

45.name: He Who Stands in the Grove
45.obtainText:
Hey! Before you head out on other adventures!
I just wanted to tell you that he who stands in the forest wanted to talk to you urgently.
He was talking about a icy region.
45.incompleteText: You got to talk to the elf in the Verdant Grove. He says it is urgent.
45.completedText: You came. I had my doubt. You know most people think I am unique. Not always in a good way. But one can never lose hope.

46.name: He Who Stands in Snow
46.obtainText:
I heard your time here soon is over and wanted to contact you. My brother is in the Icy Region to the west. I think he knows how you can get your memory back. 

If you follow the road to the west from Freydell Village, you will have the chance to find him to the North of the Icy Tundra. There you can seek his Wisdom.
46.incompleteText: So you are also just enjoying this beautiful grove. Have you met my brother to the icy west yet?
46.completedText:
Hello, stranger. I have seen you coming.
My brother sent you, didn't he?

47.name: Unknown Figure (Part 2)
47.obtainText: Maybe someone in the Town knows about this figure.
47.completedText: Oh, no, please! Not that figure! I tried to send it away with the last caravan! Please don't return it to me! You should meet with a priest and ask if he can cleanse it for you. That thing is filled by evil!

48.name: A Letter to a Father (Part 2)
48.obtainText: Maybe you can ask Ral about the letter.
48.completedText: Oh, so you found my letter. My father is a strong individual and he has been keeping the western regions safe for years. The Icy Tundra has kind of been his second home. I don't understand why he feel home there though. You would have to ask him.

49.name: 99-Year Old Wine (Part 2)
49.obtainText: Maybe someone would be glad you returned the old, exotic Wine to them?
49.completedText: Oh, look at that. Where did you find this? I lost my cargo some days ago and I am glad you returned me this treasure. You can enter my Inn whenever you like!

50.name: Why Wolves you Say?
50.obtainText:
Hello, stranger. Over the last few years, wolves have come across the border from the Glacial Tundra and made a new home here in Freydell Forest.

..And since their numbers must be decreased I wondered if you would slay some and bring me some fur so I could make a Fur Cloak to the this new outfit I have made. I am ashamed to say that I am no fighter, so I couldn't have done it myself. Would you help?
50.incompleteText: Have you found any Wolf Fur for me?
50.completedText: Oh, great, now I can make my Fur Cloak! The only thing is that I am too lazy to walk to the town to ask Grydna if she could make me the Cloak...

51.name: The Wolf Fur Cloak
51.obtainText: Can you head to Grydna in Freydell Village and ask if she could make the Fur Cloak for me?
51.incompleteText: You should bring six Fur Cloaks to the village.
51.completedText: Of course he wants me to make it for him, that lazy husband... Alright, seems you have enough for two, I can make one for you too for free.

52.name: The Wolf Fur Cloak (Part 2)
52.obtainText: Right... Head back to my lazy husband with this masterpiece. I am sure he will reward you more than me.
52.incompleteText: Did my husband like his new cloak? Have you given it yet?
52.completedText:
Oh, that is a masterpiece! Thank you, stranger! I will thank my lovely wife later!

Here is the money I promised you!

53.name: Work from Within Glacial Walls
53.obtainText:
I have come from the Elven Lands to the North. I have come here to make sure these trolls won't have supplies during this cold period.
Sadly... Trolls can recognize the smell of us Elves from the North, even in the coldest temperature.

What I mean is, If I go in, they would all know I am there. Something which is too dangerous for a lone elf to let happen. They can't smell you, can you destroy their Supply Huts for me?
53.incompleteText: I must be sure the job here is done. Have you destoyed their Supply Huts?
53.completedText: Me and the Elves of the north are thankful. Let them Ice Trolls starve.
